intro: Conceveiba guianensis, commonly known as the Guianan Conceveiba, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant has woody stems and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both ecological and horticultural study.
